title: American_Top_40_1983_August_13th
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This recording guest-hosted by Keri Tombazian is a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this countdown:

Composer, lyricist, record producer Jim Steinman has two songs debut in the top 40 the same week, "Total Eclipse Of The Heart" by Bonnie Tyler (at number 40) and "Making Love Out Of Nothing At All" by Air Supply (at number 39).

Keri tells about a band in the countdown whose drummer had to cancel a performance (with his old band) because his drums (weighing 2.5 tons) were too heavy for the stage.

A listener wants to know how many musical instruments have been named in top 40 song titles. Keri says 27 song titles have mentioned 13 different types of instruments and then gives 13 examples.

The band scoring the most top 40 hits without ever hitting number one is in this countdown, and will give its 1st live performance sine 1986 at the BBC Radio 2 Live Festival on Sunday 14th September 2014. If you put "BBC - Radio 2 Live in Hyde Park 2014 - Line up" into a search engine, you will certainly find out more!

Eddy Grant is at number 11 with his hit "Electric Avenue." Keri calls it a protest song, along with "1999" by Prince (at number 18) and "It's A Mistake" by Men At Work (at number 8).
